website_summaries.verdict: This is a well-built steam iron that's perfect for households that do a lot of ironing and need a tool that will last.
pros: Auto-clean system flushes out any mineral deposits
Precision tip for navigating around buttons and collars
cons: The water reservoir is dark, making it difficult to see when you've reached the fill line

customer_reviews.title: Terrible design
customer_reviews.text: Irons OK but terrible design. The iron must be sitting flat on it's face plate to fill it and it is almost impossible to see the water level. The temperature settings are hidden underneath the handle. With small hands, the position of the dial requires 2 hands to turn it. The iron needs to be at eye level to see it...very awkward and potentially dangerous. I made the mistake of giving it a try and it is too late to return it.
customer_reviews.author: DJ

customer_reviews.title: This was a great iron for 66 days
customer_reviews.text: This was a great iron for 66 days, then it stopped working just past the point of no return. Such a shame, Black + Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: LOVING this iron!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am a quilter and stitcher of all things. During the CoVid-19 pandemic my sewing ministry focused efforts on sewing face masks. We made well of 10,000 masks. I bought this iron because I'd had a Rowenta, and Oliso and a Black & Decker for the past 10 years. When I am working with cotton the MAIN issues I have are getting an iron that gets hot enough and an iron that has plenty of steam capacity. Black & Decker wins on BOTH of these features! Not by a little bit, but by a BIG margin! THANK YOU for making a good product at a great price and works dependably.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Great iron while it worked
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this iron, but it stopped spraying and steaming. Both are very important to me in ironing. I have always used distilled water in it. It started spitting crap all over my clothes when steaming and then the spray and steam buttons stopped working. I used a vinegar and water solution to clean it and it worked for a few weeks but back to same old stuff. I like how heavy it is and it worked great when it did. I don't want to have to buy a new iron every 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible controls and short cord
customer_reviews.text: If you iron often, this iron will frustrate you. I seems reasonably well made given the price, but the design flaws are inexcusable. I read other reviewers’ complaints about the controls, but figured, for this price, how bad can it be? BAD! They might as well have left the dial completely blank. I literally use a flashlight to set it when I turn it on. I fixed the problem with a sharpie, but come on B&D. If you’re looking for an inexpensive iron and just don’t iron much, this will do the trick; otherwise I recommend that you spend a few extra dollars on a different model
customer_reviews.author: TomP

customer_reviews.title: Definitely not a new item!
customer_reviews.text: I haven’t even plugged this in yet, but as others have stated right out of the box there are strange water like stains however I can tell it’s not water. More like chemically etched along with spots all over the place. Definitely getting returned.
customer_reviews.author: Chainpuller

customer_reviews.title: Broken after three months.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on May 29 and here it is September 11 and the heating element has already gone bad and the iron won’t heat up. It was never dropped, not heavily used. Just junk so I’m off to buy a new iron. It won’t be Black and Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Ben M. Cowan

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very nice iron. Works great. A cleaning tip. I accidentally ironed a delicate material and it kind of melted to the faceplate. So I saturated a folded washcloth with white vinegar and then just sat the cold faceplate on the washcloth, left it for about an hour. Came back and it came off very easily with a non-abrasive scrubby pad.
customer_reviews.author: CJ in Kentucky

customer_reviews.title: Leaked, was heavy & awkward-keep looking!
customer_reviews.text: This iron is too bulky & heavy- the instructions do NOT include showing what the symbols on the iron mean. It's clunky to fill with water & it LEAKED on every item I ironed- using correct temperature for 9 shirts & blouses. I'm returning this thing. Funniest thing was it has a lace at the bottom to wrap the cord but they didn't bother attaching a 5 cent "plug holder" to the end like my corner Black & Decker had. Keep looking.
customer_reviews.author: luxurykat

customer_reviews.title: Water pours out of it and too bulky
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst steam Iron i have ever bought. The water doesnt leak but it pours out from the pores. No matter what position you try to put it. As soon as its plugged in it starts leaking through all the pores.
customer_reviews.author: katlis

customer_reviews.title: Great Iron that DIES After 1 Year. What?
customer_reviews.text: Giving this 2 instead of 1 stars because if it had actually lasted longer than 1 year, it was a great iron. Great steam power and heavy enough to get out most wrinkles; worked well on linen as well. I used it almost daily. However, 1 year and 15 days from the date of purchase, it literally just stopped heating up. The power light comes on but that's about it. After reading other reviews I see that other customers have also had this issue within a similar time period. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Heather F.

customer_reviews.title: A cool looking, reliable, very functional Iron. Recommrnded!
customer_reviews.text: This is the nicest and, actually coolest looking, Iron I have ever bought. It works extremely well, easy to use settings. I was surprised when I openned it. The kid in me thought it looks like a star ship. I hadn't bought a new iron for several years, so mynprevious irons were all functional and very boring looking. It is nice to see cool styling and design can make something as mundane as an iron better. Black & Decker made reliable products. In fact, I have never had a defective item from B&D in over 30 years, that is saying something. I trust their products. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Reaper DRR  TM

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Iron, GREAT steam
customer_reviews.text: My old iron died recently and I wanted one that produces forceful steam but didn't break the bank. This Black & Decker definitely delivers on both. The tapered tip is also very nice for ironing dress shirts. It heats up quickly and produces a very hot, forceful steam--which is exactly what I needed. So far, it's performed very well and heats up very quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Drew C.

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and Functional
customer_reviews.text: This is a great iron do far. It has a very sleek modern look and I love the narrow tapered bottom for getting around buttons. Emits plenty of wrinkle smoothing steam. The only drawbacks are it is difficult to see the water level as you are refilling and as you are using it. Also it is a little on the heavy side so it may not be suitable for someone with wrist, hand elbow or shoulder injuries but the weight was not a problem for me despite my tendinitis.
customer_reviews.author: NJ Videophile

customer_reviews.title: Great iron. My whole life I have used cheap ...
customer_reviews.text: Great iron. My whole life I have used cheap irons and never knew what I was missing out on. This iron is cheap in price, but not in quality. So much easier to iron with the steam and heat setting on this. It gets all the wrinkles out so much better and quicker. I don't dry clean any of my work clothes. It has saved $100s in the one year I have already had it.
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: I have to iron all of my clothes, this is a great iron
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure about what's up with some of the bad reviews? Maybe it's because my Wal-mart iron that I bought years ago finally broke and that is what I was used to. Ironed my clothes in half the time, steam is fantastic, skinny tip on front of iron works great for detailing, feels good in the hand. The only complaint that I read that I understand is the temperature dial is hard to read, but not impossible. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brinson W Crews

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret this purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this based on some reviews. I am so glad I did buy it. I use this iron probably 6 days a week. I run a small etsy business where I make bow ties and bandanas for dogs. I went from a cheap Black and Decker one to this, and there is just no comparison. It does a great job, and the steaming works well. When I fill the tank all the way it does leak a little. But that doesn't bother me. Get the job done. I hope it holds up for a while!
customer_reviews.author: Karen I. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Impressive steam output, plenty of heat
customer_reviews.text: This iron has a substantial weight, but easy to use. The temperature setting dial is in an awkward location though, not easy to see the numbers. It puts out an amazing amount of steam, even on the medium setting. I did see some reviews that stated it was a used product they received. Both the box and the instructions clearly state that you might see some residual water marks which is expected because of their quality control testing.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen L.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: The plastic cover over the water chamber is so dark we had to use a flashlight to try and see the water level and still ended up over filling it several times and created a mess. Ordered a different iron with a more transparent plastic cover and moved this iron to the garage for woodworking projects. This could be the best iron in the world but it's definitely not worth the hassle in filling it up with water every morning.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Keep Shopping!
customer_reviews.text: I iron a lot, and purchased this model based on reviews at The Sweet Home. It is awkward to fill the water reservoir, as it is filled while sitting flat on the heat plate. The water level is also hard to see, so it is easily overfilled, or underfilled. After less than 5 months it is heating inconsistently, and leaking water from the holes on the heat plate while ironing. Do not buy this iron!!
customer_reviews.author: Beth Hutfilz

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: When I push the button to issue steam, the iron leaves a pattern of rust-colored stains on my fabric, matching the layout of the steam holes. I used bottled water, and tried filling it several times and steaming a bunch of old rags, but it never stopped leaving rust-colored stains. The product is brand new and literally did not work properly once. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lysons

customer_reviews.title: It looks sleek and works professionally but......
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Iron to replace my previous iron. I was impressed by the look and feel of it. The temp settings are OK to use and it is efficient heat wise. My only qualm with this product is that it is staining my clothes with rust colored spots when I use the steam button. I thought this was because it was new and needed to be cleaned but here we are 4 months later and it is still causing these spots on my clothing and ironing board. Not sure what is causing it but will be reaching out to the manufacturer soon.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Lyte

customer_reviews.title: After two uses I was disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After 2 uses, the iron drop lots of black dirt from the steam which stained my white shirt. Then stopped working. I would say this was just a defective one as not of my Black and Decker irons has done this.
customer_reviews.author: Abra

customer_reviews.title: A very nice iron with one exception
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn't give this iron 5 stars is because it is almost impossible to see the water level in the iron because the plastic is so dark colored. I had to take it into the kitchen under the brightest light in the house, and even then it was hard to see the water level. I don't even try anymore. I have measured the amount of water it will hold, and I fill it each time with a measuring cup.
customer_reviews.author: Lee D.

customer_reviews.title: Hubby's new iron
customer_reviews.text: I had just bought this iron a month ago. It was an awesome iron until my hubby decided to refill the water. He grabbed a cup beside the bed and filled it. It starting smelling like pancake syrup. My daughter had left her leftover sprite beside the bed in a cup and he put SPRITE in the iron by mistake!!! Yep. Big Dummy! It stunk. I ordered another one to replace is goof!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca W Knox

customer_reviews.title: Pretty is as pretty does...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very PRETTY iron but that's it. I don't know if I got a lemon but it BLASTS the steam out initially and then NOTHING!! The water reservoir empties way too fast and then it barely irons at all. The temperature controls also don't seem to work properly. After much investigation looking for the right iron---Back it goes...
customer_reviews.author: Bonita C. Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: skip this clunky, heavy iron
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap but should be. It didn't last a year. It is SUPER heavy and super big and hard to work with. Whenever I first turned it on it would heat up past the temp it was suppose to be at and you'd have to wait 5 minutes for it to cool down to the correct temperature. I used it anyway (daily). This iron replaced another one that I had for 8 years. I thought it would last longer but this one just stopped working all together. Good riddance! I really hated this iron.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: usually buy rowenta irons.... was leary ...
customer_reviews.text: usually buy rowenta irons....was leary about buying this one as it was under $40 but it works perfectly. The steam option is strong and the steam button for added pressure works well. The iron plate isn't an issue and glides across all the fabrics I've tried without issue. For under $40 I'd definitely buy again. Makes me wonder why I kept buying expensive rowenta irons when this performs toe to toe for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: freshkicks

customer_reviews.title: Leaks from the bottom when off and stored.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice steam iron. It’s medium weight, and it imitates the same design of the German made Rowenta iron. It does what it is meant to do, pretty awesome actually. However, when finished and unplugged, water drips out from the bottom near the cord connection. I’m talking puddles. It says in the manual it’s not necessary to empty water tank after using, like most irons. It leaks! defective absolutely!!
customer_reviews.author: Spencer Northcutt

customer_reviews.title: Good, but weird that is has no on/off button
customer_reviews.text: The iron works fine. I find it very strange that the only way to turn it on/off to is plug it in. Also, though auto shutoff works, the way it's activated doesn't instill confidence/faith. I wish had returned this and upgraded.
customer_reviews.author: Slooo

customer_reviews.title: This was purchased as a gift and it is now ...
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased as a gift and it is now past 30 days so I cannot return it. The product is very difficult to use. You have to turn each time to turn it on and off. The dial is extremely stiff and hard to turn.
customer_reviews.author: M. Goethe

customer_reviews.title: Impressive
customer_reviews.text: So far this has been a great iron. Don't have anything negative to say. Do wish the dial knob for heat intensity showed the various recommended fabrics. Leaves it up to you to choose correct heat.
customer_reviews.author: bm17fly

customer_reviews.title: Gets Into Tight Spaces
customer_reviews.text: This iron is the best I have ever purchased. It is a bit heavier than I am used to but its overall quality certainly makes that a minor issue. The steam options are super. It gets into tight spaces like pleats with ease. It does not drip! Truly the best iron I've every used.
customer_reviews.author: Hattie Mae

customer_reviews.title: This is the best iron I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I love this Iron. We love it so much, this is the second one we've bought. My wife kept trucking this iron upstairs to her sewing room, EVEN though I hung a fold up ironing board in our laundry room. Instead of climbing the stairs every time I need to iron, I just bought another one for her.
customer_reviews.author: T. Trebuna

customer_reviews.title: If you want a new product keep shopping
customer_reviews.text: It came used! To say I’m disappointed is an understatement! As soon as I saw the original box I knew it was used. First the box wasn’t sealed and inside it wasn’t packaged properly. It looked used, had dirty fingerprints all over it AND it still had water in the water tank from being used previously! Seriously, what am I paying my money for?!
customer_reviews.author: Alie YW

customer_reviews.title: Great buy.
customer_reviews.text: Love this iron. Once in while I forget to unplug it from out let and it shuts off or it goes on stand by or something. But it doesn’t stay hot. There is no worrying about what if gets so hot that it will start a fire. It blinks a red light to let you know it’s still connected. But it cools down without having to disconnect it. And I’ve had no problems with it. It has actually fallen from ironing board a few times but it works just the same.
customer_reviews.author: LR

customer_reviews.title: Great iron, works well
customer_reviews.text: Great iron, would t say it’s lightweight but I think that’s a good thing because it irons better that way. I bought it thinking it had a steamer function though and I can’t figure out if it really does have that.
customer_reviews.author: ateeq and amina

customer_reviews.title: Despite being heavy, an amazing iron
customer_reviews.text: Amazing iron. Doesn't have a Teflon bottom but it doesn't matter with how this iron is built. It is worth every penny. Our previous irons were $15 - $20 irons and while they worked, they just didn't do justice for us like this iron does. Yes, it is a little heavier than what we were used to, but that is because it is a bigger, stronger, heavier duty iron, so it all balances out. Would purchase again, but hoping not to have to do that for many more years.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: BLACK+DECKER D3030 Allure Professional Steam Iron, Gray/Blue
customer_reviews.text: It had been a while since I last purchased an iron and this is such a great improvement. The only complaint that I have is where the control is and it's hard to see what you're turning it too. Other than that the iron works great.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great iron!
customer_reviews.text: Great iron. It's heavy, which makes ironing out those wrinkles a breeze, and I love the steam function. The only drawback is that it does not a retractable cord. I love this iron; it's very durable and looks good too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Whitted

customer_reviews.title: 2 days shy of the 1 year anniversary this iron ...
customer_reviews.text: 2 days shy of the 1 year anniversary this iron stopped heating. The light comes on, but it is cold to the touch. I know that products are not made to last anymore, but I had hoped that the iron would lasted more than 1 year. Boy was I wrong. Now I am on the hunt for a new iron. Not sure if I want another Black and Decker though.
customer_reviews.author: K. K. W. Boschulte

customer_reviews.title: This is the best of the best for 2018 and 2019.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this iron after reading a review of the best of the year. This iron was rated the best of the best and it has met that expectation!!
customer_reviews.author: David Warren

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: It’s just ok. A little too light for me. Problem for me is it turns off entirely too fast. If you are ironing and stop to move your garment around it will shut down and will have to reheat for you to continue.
customer_reviews.author: blu930

customer_reviews.title: Will not last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2016; 2 months outside of the warranty it stopped working and will not heat up. I can live with its other annoyances: difficult to see if the water level has reached the fill line, water sometimes sputters out, iron can make a popping sound when heating up and steam can shoot out unprompted -- but I still expected more than two years of light use out of this. Looking at review sites like the Wirecutter, this iron apparently has reliability issues. Black & Decker should recall it.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Mortensen

customer_reviews.title: Ironed 4 thick cotton panels with ease
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this iron. I had originally purchased a cheaper, no name iron on Amazon that was so bad I had to return it. When I saw this B+D iron go on sale on Amazon, I bought it. My first iron job was 4 thick cotton curtain panels. This iron handled all 4 panels, the steam function was fantastic and the heat stayed constant. I am very satisfied with this iron and actually just ordered a new iron board cover to compliment the new iron. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love the weight of this sturdy iron!
customer_reviews.text: I like the weight of it. It's not too light, and just heavy enough to give my clothes a good press. There's a lot of steam that comes out of it too, which I like, because I can steam my work clothes while theyre on the hanger. The instructions say that I can iron vertically too, but I haven't figured out what that means. The iron can hold quite a lot of water, and its very easy to fill up. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product only problem is seeing the water level a bit hard to see This is my second purchase of this product very happy with its durability as well
customer_reviews.author: Mr. NAW

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I brought this in Dec 2019. I never used much and kept it in great condition. Turn the iron on in July and the light came on but no heat. The iron started leaking water. Uncovered the iron isn't working and its pass my Amazon warranty coverage. Will try to contact Black & Decker for an exchange...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best iron
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best irons that I have ever used. Kocks wrinkles out of clothes in a heartbeat very well, great purchase for the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Camitta

customer_reviews.title: It's a good iron - It's not Vision Impaired Friendly
customer_reviews.text: I'm a senior and with or without my glasses I can see the settings, nor can I see the water level. I can tell it give off a good steam blast from hearing and feeling the results. BUT - I just can see the most two important things needed to see to use the iron. I'm going to give it to my daughter. I hate having to return items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No matter what setting I put it on, high ...
customer_reviews.text: No matter what setting I put it on, high, medium or low, steam or no steam, it scorches my shirts and develops roughness on the soleplate. I wish I had realized this within the 30 day return period. As it is, I guess I'm out the $35 I paid for it plus the cost of a new iron to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: JPK

customer_reviews.title: garbage!!  Spits water all over clothes leaving stains
customer_reviews.text: I used the iron once. It spit water all over my clothes when attempting to use steam.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be a modern mom
customer_reviews.text: I needed an iron. I needed to become domesticated again I havent ironed in 10 to 15 years. This made it easy to remember how
customer_reviews.author: paula

customer_reviews.title: Find a different iron. Deteriorated after 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: Iron worked fine in the beginning. Then it rusted out from the inside, despite Auto Clean function and manufacturer's claims to the contrary. Spray and steam buttons all broke in the 11th month.
customer_reviews.author: Mike P.

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this iron. I took a long time selecting one. I'm an engineer - a guy living alone. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Old Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason B&D is #1
customer_reviews.text: Simply amazing. I've always used a popular German branded iron as my mother always owned one when I was growing up. I grew up to purchase the same, but the quality has slipped over the years, they would burn out after sometimes not even a year with regular use. I went with Black & Decker, there's a reason it's the best selling brand of steam irons. I've only had this iron for a couple months, but it's proving to be a great choice.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Hosang

customer_reviews.title: Defective push buttons
customer_reviews.text: I had bought this iron and enjoyed it for 8 years. Then it died. This is the second replacement in less than 6 weeks. The spray of steam and water spray buttons break and don’t work after one week of ironing a few pairs of pants. Loved my old one. New models have a defective part. I’m looking at other bends and Consumers Report for recommendations. Very disappointed. And now after second defective one, I’m having to fight to get a refund. Bad business.
customer_reviews.author: Kat R

customer_reviews.title: Broken iron but bad design
customer_reviews.text: The iron didn't work. It heated up for about 2 min and then never heated up again. Although granted it seems like a defective unit but the water reservoir is too dark and you can't see when the water is at the max line. Additionally, it's difficult to see what temp the iron is set at, the dial is crammed under the handle. It's also a pretty heavy iron.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Alcain

customer_reviews.title: it's an iron
customer_reviews.text: great iron but the temp control is hard to read as its the same color as the body of the iron
customer_reviews.author: Insiviable Granny

customer_reviews.title: I iron everyday and love this iron
customer_reviews.text: I use my ironing board and iron as sewing tools everyday. This iron is lightweight, heats up fast and glides. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is better than the $89 Iron I bought that just kept ...
customer_reviews.text: Does the job. This is better than the $89 Iron I bought that just kept wetting all my clothes. That said, I should have invested in an iron with a retracting cord.
customer_reviews.author: insertwittyhandle

customer_reviews.title: One Problem
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that I don 't like about this iron is that the water level is very hard to see. The tank is gray so it's very difficult to see when it's time to fill it and how much water to put in. Other than that, I love this iron!!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara C. Reiter

customer_reviews.title: Horrible product!! Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have received my replacement because the first one I got did not work. Light turns on, but the iron never got heat. Just opened my new one. And same thing!! No heat, & it’s been connected for about 10 minutes now. I am very upset!
customer_reviews.author: Amayrani Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: Warning: This iron weighs over 3 lbs and the listing said it was 1.89 lbs.
customer_reviews.text: This iron weighs over 3 lbs and the listing said it was 1.89 lbs. I bought this iron because it said that it was less than 2 lbs. I have a bad shoulder and was looking to buy a lighter weight iron. I am so dissappointed. I did not plug it in, so I can't say how well it works.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You need this now
customer_reviews.text: Solid great iron. best i’ve had to be honest. Made the most wrinkled linen shirt smooth as glass
customer_reviews.author: simon pratchett

customer_reviews.title: Great iron
customer_reviews.text: I have used this iron now for a couple of weeks so I cannot tell you if it is durable, but it sure is a joy to iron with. It steams wonderful, is lightweight and easy to fill. Great iron so far!
customer_reviews.author: diana deburr

customer_reviews.title: but I figured if i were to start i'd get a good iron! Love this one
customer_reviews.text: I'm a guy and not big on ironing, but I figured if i were to start i'd get a good iron! Love this one. Heats up well and has some weight to it getting out wrinkles pretty easily. Would make this purchase again! seems like a quality product
customer_reviews.author: micah

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the Automatic Steam Toggle doesn't work.
customer_reviews.text: The 'Auto Steam' (or whatever you want to call it) doesn't work properly. The number setting for it doesn't seem to have any effect on the steam output, not to mention that when it is on, the steam sporadically changes pressure and volume. Otherwise, I manually press the steam button and it works wonderfully.
customer_reviews.author: Zeroatu

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I don't iron often, but when I do, this iron gets the job done. No issues with dripping water. I fill it with tap water and have not seen any calcium build up so far.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Poor iron
customer_reviews.text: I have this iron. Bought 3 months ago. It now shuts off and on while being used. Do not like the placement of dials.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Gaskins

customer_reviews.title: Great steam, pointed tip and weighted press!
customer_reviews.text: What a difference in iron makes! I am a sewer and a good iron that provides great steam, a good point and some weight to ensure a good first press on seams Is invaluable. This iron delivers!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Had this iron over 4 years. Did not use it too often, but it worked well when I did use it. It decided to stop heating up despite the light turning on. Tried descaling didn’t work.
customer_reviews.author: emilio

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in less than a week
customer_reviews.text: Bought this iron less than a week ago. I’ve only used it for 4 days and today the iron stopped working. The light comes on, but the heating plate is barely warm to the touch and no steam. I even jiggled the cord, tried different outlets and tried changing the heat setting—nothing worked. Very disappointed that the product stopped working in under a week.
customer_reviews.author: acon

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is really easy to use. I sew a lot so that means I press a lot too. This iron makes pressing easy and works really really well. I’m very very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: Rachel G.

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: Why go buy an expensive iron, this works like i spent a million bucks . Love it gŕeat value
customer_reviews.author: tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Best Iron I ever had out of many
customer_reviews.text: Love this Iron it has great heat control and dreams like pro. Never have a problem with scorching. Perfect weight I do not have to keep going over the jeans like with my old iron. Only thing that could use improvement is the print on the dial wear off really quick and is hard to see the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Smiling1

customer_reviews.title: stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for 11 months now and it simply stopped working. I looked online on the Black and Decker website and turns out that this is a common problem
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A. Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Great basic iron
customer_reviews.text: This is a great standard iron, does the job. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: M.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product but a little heavy
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built iron. Heats up fast, steam works great and no drips. Definitely a higher quality iron at a lower price point. It is a bit on the heavy side though.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D.

customer_reviews.title: Best iron ever!
customer_reviews.text: Ironing is normally a chore no one likes. But with this iron my wife acts like she is having a ball. She is literally ironing clothes like crazy. My daughter was down visiting and my wife was bragging about her new iron. Crazy I know! Well, my daughter was so impressed that she ordered it too.
customer_reviews.author: Randy T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this iron
customer_reviews.text: This iron is very poorly designed. The temperature control is located below the handle and is difficult to see. The water tank is a dark gray color and it is hard to see how much water you have in the iron. I wish I never purchased this iron. Not up to the standard of Black & Decker.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great steamer!
customer_reviews.text: This iron gets very hot, it steams great, and is a heavy iron, just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.author: K. Hayson

customer_reviews.title: Very substantial iron
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I decided to start laundering my work shirts at home instead of at the cleaners to save a few bucks. This is a very serious iron and seems to do a good job. Some past less expensive irons have leaked so we'll see how this one does over time, but so far I'm very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: G DUNCAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice iron but can’t  see water level.
customer_reviews.text: Water fill line very difficult to see. Otherwise very pleased. Heats up quickly, can adjust for “no steam”, nicely tapered tip.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Reardon

customer_reviews.title: Steam function works and Iron does not leak as mentioned by other reviewers.
customer_reviews.text: I use this iron daily to prepare my shirts for work. The steam function is a life saver and I will never use an iron without it again after using this one. It makes ironing my shirts take 3-4x less than it used to take me using an iron and a spray bottle. My iron is refilled constantly and has yet to have a problem with leaking.
customer_reviews.author: Michael M.

customer_reviews.title: Love this iron
customer_reviews.text: I love the look. the steam setting works well and the iron itself is light weight. It's everything in need in an iron. I would purchase another one as a gift for a sewing friend!
customer_reviews.author: Maria G.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one in 8 years. Very happy with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Darin M.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible iron
customer_reviews.text: Terrible iron!! Heavy Does not glide easily Dial is impossible to read
customer_reviews.author: lea

customer_reviews.title: It is not durable
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this iron a 5 because I love it so muc.h. This is the third one I have bought. However it is not durable - barely lasts a year. If the same thing happens with this one, I am going to move on to something else.
customer_reviews.author: Faye East

customer_reviews.title: I purchased it, because of the safety feature of ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it, because of the safety feature of turning itself off. I don't have to worry about leaving the house and wondering if I left the iron on.
customer_reviews.author: Ardella Emery

customer_reviews.title: Slick and smooth
customer_reviews.text: A slick and smooth operator. It can be a bit heavy to maneuver for small/petite hands.
customer_reviews.author: Anne M

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this iron. Not easy to use and extremely difficult to set the temp! Do not know why they refer to it as “professional”. Can’t imagine a professional using it at all!
customer_reviews.author: S Gust

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Iron
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this Iron for 2 years now and have never had a problem. Works great on all fabrics and is very powerful. I used to have a Rowenta and this is comparable in performance for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: died after 2 months of sporadic use
customer_reviews.text: argh- need iron for sewing to press seams etc- this did not last 2 months- return window closed :(
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Breaks within a month
customer_reviews.text: I had the new iron for one month and it broke and will not heat up. Of course I missed the return date by two days so all I can do is toss it in the trash. Nice a shiny -- but does not heat up. One might want to look for a more reliable brand.
customer_reviews.author: William Kapfer

customer_reviews.title: Effective but very steamy
customer_reviews.text: It definitely gets wrinkles out, but the steam can be a bit intense. Even on lower settings, when I rotate the iron 90 degrees (ie, from resting on the heel to actually ironing something) it often sputters and water droplets come out in addition to huge clouds of steam.
customer_reviews.author: commune

customer_reviews.title: tough one.
customer_reviews.text: dropped twice but just continues to work great. one star missing because the indicator does not specify heat by clothing.
customer_reviews.author: Sreenivas P Pondicherry

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t heat up after two weeks of use
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t work after two weeks Don’t waste you money Leaks water over your clothes
customer_reviews.author: Jayla taliaferro

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: Great iron easy to use and it's serve the purpose
customer_reviews.author: BEVERLEY S HENRY

customer_reviews.title: When you want to buy something once , here is your opportunity
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy, perfect, I don't think I'll ever need another one for the rest of my life
customer_reviews.author: Joseph E. Piche'

product_meta.title: BLACK+DECKER D3030 Allure Professional Steam Iron, Gray/Blue
product_meta.description: Blast through ironing jobs quickly and effectively with the BLACK+DECKER Allure Professional Steam Iron. Dynamic Steam technology generates 30% more steam* for crisp, professional results in no time. Customize settings according to fabric type with the variable temperature and steam controls. Dual moisture control buttons give you the power to blast tough wrinkles with steam or gently mist fabrics to dampen while ironing. Plus, the vertical steaming feature allows you to steam clothes right on the hanger for quick touchups, or steam drapes and upholstery. From ease of use to the quick, professional results, it’s no wonder the Allure iron is from BLACK+DECKER, the trusted name in clothes irons. Volts: 120V,Wattage: 1600W. Item Weight: 3.03lbs
feature_bullets: Stainless Steel Soleplate - The durable, heavy-duty soleplate glides smoothly over all fabric types to press out wrinkles in no time
Auto Clean System - Keep the iron at peak performance with the Auto Clean system, which flushes out mineral deposits
Variable Temperature and Steam Controls - Independent steam and temperature controls give you the ability to customize each setting separately for the best results across all fabric types
Automatic Shutoff - For added peace of mind, the iron shuts off when left unattended for 30 seconds on its side or soleplate, and after 8 minutes on the heel rest

Dynamic Steam Technology - The Allure iron produces over 30% more steam* to quickly cut through wrinkles and create long-lasting, crisp results on clothes, linens, and more *When compared to Shark GI405 and T-Fal FV4476

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,574 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
